he that hath the key of David

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: I have set before thee an open door

theologische_implicaties: Sovereignty of Christ over human obstacles
onbedoelde_consequenties: Determinism (if God shuts it, no effort matters)

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'Open Door' by linking it to specific socio-political contexts (elections) and personal history.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the architectural metaphor of the 'door' with the relational metaphor of the 'parent' to explain why the door is open (grace).

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher argues you can't get God in debt, then immediately uses a child's gift to a parent to describe works.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Commercial debt requires exact repayment; parental love accepts 'smudgy' failure.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Scaling the power of the source domain (keys) from local doors to cosmic boundaries.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activating the 'Open Door' metaphor by applying it to a 1500-dollar scholarship and an election.
sterktes.voorbeeld: In this Concord Times, a scholarship... waiting for somebody to take it.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'Open Door' risks being reduced to material/financial success (Prosperity Gospel undertones).
risicos.voorbeeld: We will be able to declare that we want a piece of the pie.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God primarily as a facilitator of career/financial advancement.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The ancient city of Philadelphia on the Roman postal route.
sub_worlds: The domestic scene of a child giving a gift

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Excellent use of contrast to ground the hearer.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeated emphasis on God opening doors that humans cannot shut.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits a 'Call to Action' or 'Encouragement' liturgical moment.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the ARCHITECTURAL domain (Doors/Keys), which serves as a powerful cognitive bridge between ancient text and modern aspiration. It effectively uses the RELATIONAL domain to soften the potential harshness of the JURIDICAL/ECONOMIC language often found in Revelation.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Use the 'Wholly Other' (Hagios) concept to describe a different 'frequency' or 'dimension' of living.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Holiness is not a list of 'no's', it is being tuned to a different world's music.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Clarify that the 'works' are the 'thank you note' rather than the 'payment'.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests limited resources (if I get a piece, you get less).
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Shift to 'Abundance' metaphors where the 'pie' grows.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'Open Door' (instant access) with the 'Growth' (patience) required in faith.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in taking a 'dead' biblical metaphor (the open door) and making it physically felt in the lives of the congregation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on the 'Door' as a cognitive map for navigation rather than just a poetic image of hope.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'feeling' to the logical entailments of what a 'shut door' does to the believer's psyche.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals how the preacher uses the 'Key' metaphor to transition from human agency to divine absolute sovereignty.

appendices.notities: The preacher's use of personal narrative (father's death) serves as a 'Source Domain' for the 'Closed Door' experience, making the 'Open Door' target domain more visceral.
